msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto;Some writing on Verso
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 3159; 4910

condition.ab: Regulary cut in two cuts at the left hand side. kollesis at the middle of the papyrus, before col. 146,. The papyrus is damaged and mutilated as a result of a fold at the middle of col. 145 and the beginning of col. 146. Generaly, it is damaged from top and bottom; a big lacuna at the middle; strips of fibers are frayed at the top of the right side. No restoration is needed. (MA)

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. The scribe separated the new entry from the preceding one by underlining the name of the taxpayer and marking an oblique stroke going downwards to the left margin in other lines.

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Ptolemaios, son of Harpagathes, grandson of Heras, Segathis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 217)
Tasiaipis, son of Onnophris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 238)
Kastor, son of Kastor, grand son of Apollonios, mother Heraklous (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 181)
Sisois, slave of Tasoucharion, daughter of Thaisas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 229)
Ptolemaios, son of Herakleides, grandson of Akous, mother Diodora (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 217)
Zenas, son of Phaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 165)
Satis, son of Heron (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 227)
Ammonios alias Diodoros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 151)
Onnophris, son of Onnophris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 191)
Petaus, son of Petaus, grandson of Petheus, mother Isis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 209)
Pnepheros, the brother (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 213)
Gellios Klemes through Isidoros (Knosenete) (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 160)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
